DataElement.preferredName: Diagnosis Performed Observation Outcome Disease or Disorder Status Missing Reason Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded value specifying why a disease status is missing. EXAMPLE(S): "the sample was damaged" is a reason code within the "unevaluable" classification. NOTE(S): The distinctions between unevaluable, missing reason and not assessed, will be made in the hierarchy of the reason codes and need not be made as distinct attributes, since they are mutually exclusive.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diagnosis Performed Observation Outcome Disease or Disorder Status Missing Reason Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:A condition or state at a particular time.:Not existing; not able to be found.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
Executed and carried through to completion.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.

Property.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Status Missing Reason Code
Property.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:A condition or state at a particular time.:Not existing; not able to be found.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
A condition or state at a particular time.
Not existing; not able to be found.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
